body:
# DPPM REST API

[![Build Status](https://cloud.drone.io/api/badges/DFabric/dppm-rest-api/status.svg)](https://cloud.drone.io/DFabric/dppm-rest-api)
[![Gitter](https://img.shields.io/badge/chat-on_gitter-red.svg?style=flat-square)](https://gitter.im/DFabric/Lobby)
[![ISC](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-ISC-blue.svg?style=flat-square)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISC_license)

REST API for [DPPM](https://github.com/DFabric/dppm), an installer/manager of server applications.

## Documentation

https://dfabric.github.io/dppm-rest-api

## Development

You will need a [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org) development environment.

You can either [install it](https://crystal-lang.org/docs/installation) or use a [Docker image](https://hub.docker.com/r/jrei/crystal-alpine).

### Compilation

Clone the repository and run:

`shards build`

The binary is `bin/dppm`

### Run tests

This runs the formatter, the linter, then the spec tests:

`crystal tool format && bin/ameba && crystal spec`

## Commands for setting permissions
The `dppm server` command has two subcommands for managing user permissions:
`user` and `group`. This API uses a role-based access model. That is, a user
itself does not have permissions, it is a member of a group (a role) which
then has a defined set of permissions.

A user has three attributes -- a name, for referring to the user directly;
an API key, for authentication; and a list of groups of which it is a member.

### Editing users

For the edit, rekey, show, and delete commands, the users may be selected
either by sepecifying a user's API key, if it is known, or by matching the name
and groups the user is a member of. It is not recommended to match only by name
or by groups, as your command may unintentionally affect similar users. For
example, two users may choose the same name, but be members of different
groups. This doesn't matter as they're only identified internally by their
API keys, but you may unintentionally add/remove groups from those users when
using this command in that situation.

Ideally, you won't have multiple users with the same name, or you can use the
web interface to edit these values using API keys for exact identification.

This can also be used for batch processing. For example, if you want to replace
one group with several more granular ones, you can add all members of the old
group to the new groups before deleting the old group.

#### Matching on users
You may use an exact match like `match-name=Scott`, or by using regex, like
`match-name='/(D\..)?Scott.Boggs\d{0,2}/'`. In either case, ANY matching user
is selected, so again, if there are multiple users with the same name, they
will *all* be selected.

#### Matching on groups
Group matches are non-exclusive -- that is, users may also be members of groups
*not* specified, but they must be a member of the specified groups. You may
specify several groups by separating them with commas, and multiple group
selectors by separating them with a colon, like `match-groups=1,2,3:2,4`, which
would select a user who's a member of groups 1, 2, and 3, or a user who's a member
of groups 2 and 4.

## Contributors

- [D. Scott Boggs](https://github.com/dscottboggs) - creator and maintainer
- [Julien Reichardt](https://github.com/j8r) - contributor and backer

## License

Copyright (c) 2018-2020 DFabric members - ISC License

def.name: define_error

types.name: DppmRestApi
types.doc: A series of utility functions for selecting and modifying users and groups
types.summary: A series of utility functions for selecting and modifying users and groups

class_methods.name: run
class_methods.args_string: (host : String, port : Int32, data_dir : String, webui_folder : String? = nil, prefix : String = DPPM::Prefix.default)

class_methods.name: run
class_methods.args_string: (host : String, port : Int32, data_dir : String, prefix : DPPM::Prefix, webui_folder : String? = nil)

def.name: run
def.body:
@@permissions_config = Config.read(data_dir)
Actions::Route.prefix = prefix
HTTP::Status.each do |status|
  if status.value >= 400
    Kemal.config.add_error_handler(status.value) do |context, exception|
      if exception.is_a?(Actions::HTTPStatusError)
        context.response.status_code = exception.status_code.value
      end
      response_data = Actions::ErrorResponse.new(exception)
      response_data.to_json(context.response)
      context.response.flush
      response_data.log
      nil
    end
  end
end
if webui_folder
  public_folder(path: webui_folder)
end
Kemal.config.host_binding = host
Kemal.run(port: port)

def.name: from_value
def.body:
if 0 > value && value > Access::All.value
  raise("Invalid variant of Access recieved: #{value}")
end
variant = Access::None
{% for variant in @type.constants %}
      variant |= {{ variant.id }} if (value & {{ variant.id }}.value) > 0
      {% end %}
variant

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (pull parser : JSON::PullParser) : Access

def.name: new
def.body:
case parser.kind
when .int?
  number = parser.read_int
  from_value(number)
when .string?
  read = parser.read_string
  if read.includes?('|')
    value = Access::None
    read.split('|') do |substr|
      value = value | (parse(substr.strip))
    end
    value
  else
    parse(read)
  end
when .begin_array?
  value = Access::None
  parser.read_array do
    str = parser.read_string
    parsed = parse(str)
    value = value | parsed
  end
  value
else
  raise(JSON::ParseException.new("Trying to parse Access (integer, string, or array of strings) but found\na value of type \"#{parser.kind}\".", parser.line_number, parser.column_number))
end

def.name: to_json
def.body:
builder.array do
  each do |variant|
    builder.string(variant.to_s)
  end
end

def.name: valid_streams
def.body:
Array(String).new.tap do |streams|
  app.each_log_stream do |stream|
    streams << stream
  end
end

def.name: new
def.body:
if error.is_a?(HTTPStatusError)
  new(type: error.class.to_s, message: error.message, status_code: error.status_code)
else
  new(type: error.class.to_s, message: error.message)
end

constructors.args_string: (errors : Array(ErrorData))

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (error)

def.name: new
def.body:
messages = [ErrorData.new(error)]
if error = error.cause
  messages << (ErrorData.new(error))
end
new(messages)

instance_methods.name: log
instance_methods.doc:
Log this response using the default Kemal logger.

TODO support custom formatting.
instance_methods.summary: Log this response using the default Kemal logger.

def.name: log
def.body:
errors.each do |error|
  message = String.build do |msg|
    (((msg << "ERROR@") << Time.utc) << " type: ") << error.type
    if error.status_code
      (msg << "; status: ") << error.status_code
    end
    ((msg << "; message: ") << error.message) || "(nil)"
  end
  log(message)
end

def.name: query_params_in_body?
def.body:
begin
  if body = context.request.body
    Hash(String, Array(String)).from_json(body)
  else
    Hash(String, Array(String)).new
  end
rescue e : JSON::ParseException
  raise(BadRequest.new(context, "Expected either a valid JSON Hash of String to Array of String, or no\nspecified request body at #{context.request.path}", cause: e))
end

def.name: build_config_response
def.body:
builder.field(package.package) do
  builder.object do
    package.each_config_key do |key|
      builder.field(key, package.get_config(key))
    end
  end
end

def.name: new
def.body:
route = new(root_path)
with route yield
route

instance_methods.name: relative_delete
instance_methods.doc:
Perform a relative delete from the `root_path`.
That is, these routes are namespaced underneath a route generated by the name
of the type this method is included on. If a route is defined with
```
delete("/some/:path") { ... }
```
Then the actual path a request should be made on is
`"@root_path/some/path-param"`
instance_methods.summary: Perform a relative delete from the #root_path.

def.name: relative_delete
def.body:
delete(root_path + route.to_s) do |context|
  begin
    user = @@access_filter.call(context, Access::Delete)
    block.call(context, user)
  rescue ex : Actions::Exception
    raise(ex)
  rescue ex
    raise(InternalServerError.new(context, cause: ex))
  end
end

instance_methods.name: relative_get
instance_methods.doc:
Perform a relative get from the `root_path`.
That is, these routes are namespaced underneath a route generated by the name
of the type this method is included on. If a route is defined with
```
get("/some/:path") { ... }
```
Then the actual path a request should be made on is
`"@root_path/some/path-param"`
instance_methods.summary: Perform a relative get from the #root_path.

def.name: relative_get
def.body:
get(root_path + route.to_s) do |context|
  begin
    user = @@access_filter.call(context, Access::Read)
    block.call(context, user)
  rescue ex : Actions::Exception
    raise(ex)
  rescue ex
    raise(InternalServerError.new(context, cause: ex))
  end
end

class_methods.name: get_prefix_with_source_name
class_methods.doc: Get a prefix from a context, which has a source name.
class_methods.summary: Get a prefix from a context, which has a source name.

def.name: get_prefix_with_source_name
def.body: DPPM::Prefix.new(path: prefix.path.to_s, group: prefix.group, source_name: URI.decode(context.params.url["source_name"]), source_path: prefix.source_path)

def.name: prefix
def.body:
if (value = @@prefix).nil?
  @@prefix = (raise("No prefix set"))
else
  value
end

instance_methods.name: build_json_array
instance_methods.doc: Like `#build_json_object`, but builds an array instead of an object
instance_methods.summary: Like #build_json_object, but builds an array instead of an object

def.name: build_json_array
def.body:
build_json(response) do |json|
  json.array do
    yield json
  end
end

instance_methods.name: build_json_object
instance_methods.doc:
Build JSON directly to the HTTP response IO. This yields inside of an
object labelled "data", like
```
{"data": {"whatever": "you build"}}
```
Since it's in an object, one needs to use `JSON::Builder#field` at the
top-level within the block.

NOTE: One must also ensure that the block does not raise an exception --
this would result in invalid JSON being output as the response body. For
example...
```
build_json_object do
  raise InternalServerError.new "Oh no!"
end
```
...would result in the following response body...
```
{"data":{"errors": [{"type": "InternalServerError", "status_code": 500, "message": "oh no!"}]}
```
...which is not valid JSON due to the unclosed object written at the beginning.
instance_methods.summary: Build JSON directly to the HTTP response IO.

def.name: build_json_object
def.body:
build_json(response) do |json|
  json.object do
    yield json
  end
end

instance_methods.name: parse_boolean_param
instance_methods.doc:
This method parses a boolean value from a query parameter. It returns
true when the query parameter is specified, but empty; false when the
parameter is not specified (null); and otherwise raises a BadRequest
exception.
instance_methods.summary: This method parses a boolean value from a query parameter.

def.name: parse_boolean_param
def.body:
context.params.query[key]?.try do |value|
  if value.empty?
    return true
  end
  raise(BooleanParamHasValue.new(context, key, value))
end
false

types.name: RouteFilters
types.doc:
A series of filters, which may be parsed from the current context. They
currently allow filtering the #pkg_file attributes of DPPM::Prefix's Pkg,
App, and Src.
types.summary: A series of filters, which may be parsed from the current context.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (context : HTTP::Server::Context)

def.name: new
def.body:
this = new
(context.params.query.fetch_all("filter")).map(&.split('=')).each do |filter|
  if filter.size < 2
    raise(InvalidFilter.new(context))
  end
  this.add(key: filter[0], values: filter[1..])
end
this

instance_methods.name: add
instance_methods.doc:
Add a single value to the filters on the given key. If there are already
some filters on this key, the original values are kept as well.
instance_methods.summary: Add a single value to the filters on the given key.

def.name: add
def.body:
if self[key]?.try do |set|
  set << value
end
else
  self[key] = Set {value}
end

instance_methods.name: add
instance_methods.doc:
Add a series of values to the filters on the given key. If there are
already some filters on this key, the original values are kept as well.
instance_methods.summary: Add a series of values to the filters on the given key.

def.name: add
def.body:
if has_key?(key)
  __temp_70 = key
  self[__temp_70] = self[__temp_70] & values.to_set
else
  self[key] = values.to_set
end

build the JSON list of data from the package files of all apps
that pass the filters.
instance_methods.summary: build the JSON list of data from the package files of all apps that pass the filters.

def.name: apps_json
def.body:
builder.array do
  Route.prefix.each_app do |app|
    if filters_allow?(app.pkg_file)
      app.pkg_file.to_json(builder, keys)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: filters_allow?
instance_methods.doc: Return true if the given package file's attributes pass the filters
instance_methods.summary: Return true if the given package file's attributes pass the filters

def.name: filters_allow?
def.body:
keep = true
pkg_file.each_ivar do |key, value|
  if filter_set = self[key]?
    if filter_set.includes?(value)
    else
      keep = false
    end
  end
end
keep

instance_methods.name: add_group
instance_methods.doc: Adds a group with the given values
instance_methods.summary: Adds a group with the given values

def.name: add_group
def.body:
required(id, name, permissions, data_dir)
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
id_number = id.to_i? || (abort("failed to convert group ID #{id} to an integer"))
if group = current_config.groups.find do |__arg0|
  __arg0.id == id
end
  raise("A group with the id #{id} already exists: " + group.name)
end
perms = Hash(String, DppmRestApi::Config::Route).from_json(permissions)
new_group = DppmRestApi::Config::Group.new(name, id_number, perms)
current_config.groups << new_group
current_config.sync_to_disk

instance_methods.name: add_route
instance_methods.doc:
Allow the group with the given id to access the given request path at the
given access level.
instance_methods.summary: Allow the group with the given id to access the given request path at the given access level.

def.name: add_route
def.body:
required(id, access, path, data_dir)
group_id_number = id.to_i? || (raise(InvalidGroupID.new(id)))
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
relevant_group = current_config.groups.find do |grp|
  grp.id == group_id_number
end || (raise(NoSuchGroup.new(group_id_number)))
parsed_access = DppmRestApi::Access.parse(access)
route = DppmRestApi::Config::Route.new(parsed_access)
relevant_group.permissions[path] = route
current_config.sync_to_disk

instance_methods.name: add_user
instance_methods.doc:
Add a user. The user's API key will be output to `output_file`, or `STDOUT`
if not specified. If the key is output to STDOUT, the user is also given
the chance to cancel the process after being shown their API key.
instance_methods.summary: Add a user.

def.name: add_user
def.body:
required(data_dir, groups, name)
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
group_list = split_numbers(groups)
api_key, user = DppmRestApi::Config::User.create(group_list, name)
current_config.users << user
current_config.sync_to_disk
api_key

def.name: delete_group
def.body:
required(id, data_dir)
group_id_number = id.to_i? || (raise(InvalidGroupID.new(id)))
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
current_config.groups.reject! do |group|
  group.id == group_id_number
end
current_config.sync_to_disk

def.name: delete_users
def.body:
required(data_dir, user_id)
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
current_config.users.reject! do |user|
  user.id == user_id
end
current_config.sync_to_disk

instance_methods.name: edit_access
instance_methods.doc: Edits the given group's access level on the given path
instance_methods.summary: Edits the given group's access level on the given path

def.name: edit_access
def.body:
required(id, access, path, data_dir)
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
id_number = id.to_i? || (raise(InvalidGroupID.new(id)))
group = current_config.groups.find do |__arg1|
  __arg1.id == id_number
end
if !group
  raise(NoSuchGroup.new(id_number))
end
current_config.groups.delete(group)
parsed_access = (Access.parse?(access)) || (Access.from_value(access.to_i? || (raise(InvalidAccessParam.new(access)))))
original_cfg = group.permissions[path]? || (Config::Route.new(parsed_access))
original_cfg.permissions = parsed_access
group.permissions[path] = original_cfg
current_config.groups << group
current_config.sync_to_disk

def.name: edit_group_query
def.body:
required(id, key, path, data_dir)
group_id_number = id.to_i? || (raise(InvalidGroupID.new(id)))
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
relevant_group = current_config.groups.find do |grp|
  grp.id == group_id_number
end
relevant_group || (raise(NoSuchGroup.new(group_id_number)))
if add_glob
  if route = relevant_group.permissions[path]?
    if route.query_parameters[key]?
      relevant_group.permissions[path].query_parameters[key] << add_glob
    else
      relevant_group.permissions[path].query_parameters[key] = [add_glob]
    end
  else
    raise(NoRouteMatchForThisGroup.new(path, group_id_number))
  end
end
if remove_glob
  relevant_group.permissions[path].query_parameters[key].delete(remove_glob)
  if relevant_group.permissions[path].query_parameters[key].empty?
    relevant_group.permissions[path].query_parameters.delete(key)
  end
end
current_config.sync_to_disk

def.name: edit_users
def.body:
required(data_dir, user_id)
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
user_index = current_config.users.index do |usr|
  usr.id == user_id
end
if user_index.nil?
  raise("No user found with id #{user_id}")
end
user = current_config.users[user_index]
new_name.try do |specified_new_name|
  user.name = specified_new_name
end
add_groups.try do |groups_to_add|
  split_numbers(groups_to_add) do |id|
    user.join_group(id)
  end
end
remove_groups.try do |groups_to_remove|
  split_numbers(groups_to_remove) do |id|
    user.leave_group(id)
  end
end
current_config.users[user_index] = user
current_config.sync_to_disk

def.name: rekey_users
def.body:
required(data_dir, user_id)
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
user_index = current_config.users.index do |user|
  user.id == user_id
end
if user_index.nil?
  raise("No user found with id #{user_id}")
end
user = current_config.users[user_index]
new_key = Random::Secure.base64(24)
user.api_key_hash = Scrypt::Password.create(new_key)
current_config.users[user_index] = user
current_config.sync_to_disk
new_key

def.name: run_server
def.body:
if port.is_a?(String)
  port = port.to_i
end
if config
  dppm_config = File.open(config) do |file|
    DPPM::Prefix::Config.new(file)
  end
  port || (port = dppm_config.port)
  host || (host = dppm_config.host)
end
DppmRestApi.run(host: host, port: port, data_dir: data_dir, webui_folder: webui_folder)

instance_methods.name: show_users
instance_methods.doc: Returns thes information about the selected users.
instance_methods.summary: Returns thes information about the selected users.

def.name: show_users
def.body:
required(data_dir)
current_config = Config.read(data_dir)
users = selected_users(match_name, match_groups, api_key, from: current_config.users)
JSON.build(DPPM::Logger.output, indent: 2) do |builder|
  users.to_json(builder)
end
DPPM::Logger.output.puts
users

macros.doc:
All variables are received by a method as a `String | Nil`. This macro
converts an argument, by name, to its `String` value, or raises an
error instructing the user to include the variable value.
macros.summary: All variables are received by a method as a String | Nil.

def.name: required
run

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (pull : JSON::PullParser)

constructors.name: read
constructors.args_string: (data_dir : String = DEFAULT_DATA_DIR) : self

def.name: read
def.body:
config_file = Path[data_dir, FILE]
if File.exists?(config_file)
  permissions_config = nil
  File.open(config_file) do |data|
    permissions_config = Config.from_json(data)
    permissions_config.file_path = config_file
    permissions_config
  end
else
  Config.new(data_dir: data_dir)
end

def.name: find_and_authenticate!
def.body:
begin
  data = ReceivedUser.from_json(body)
  if key = data.auth?
    users.find do |__arg0|
      __arg0.api_key_hash.verify(key)
    end
  end
rescue JSON::ParseException
  nil
end

instance_methods.name: sync_to_disk
instance_methods.doc: Saves the configuration to a file at `filepath`.
instance_methods.summary: Saves the configuration to a file at filepath.

def.name: sync_to_disk
def.body:
begin
  prefix = @file_path.basename(suffix: ".json")
  suffix = @file_path.extension
  dirname = @file_path.dirname
  if !(Dir.exists?(dirname))
    Dir.mkdir(dirname)
  end
  tmp_file = File.tempfile(prefix, suffix, dir: dirname) do |file|
    to_json(file, indent: 2)
  end
  File.rename(tmp_file.path, @file_path.to_s)
ensure
  begin
    tmp_file.try(&.delete)
  rescue File::NotFoundError
  end
end

def.name: to_json
def.body:
JSON.build(io, indent: indent) do |builder|
  to_json(builder)
end

instance_methods.name: can_access?
instance_methods.doc:
returns true if members of this group may access a request on the given
route, with the given permission level.
instance_methods.summary: returns true if members of this group may access a request on the given route, with the given permission level.
instance_methods.args_string: (path : String, query : HTTP::Params, requested_permissions : Access) : Bool

def.name: can_access?
def.body:
permissions.each do |pattern, route|
  if (File.match?(pattern, path)) && (route.match?(query))
    if route.permissions.includes?(requested_permissions)
      return true
    end
  end
end
false

instance_methods.name: each_group
instance_methods.doc: Yields each Group to the block for which the user is a member of.
instance_methods.summary: Yields each Group to the block for which the user is a member of.

instance_methods.name: find_group?
instance_methods.doc:
Yield each group to a block and return the first group for which the block
returns a truthy value
instance_methods.summary: Yield each group to a block and return the first group for which the block returns a truthy value

def.name: find_group?
def.body:
each_group do |group|
  if yield group
    return group
  end
end

instance_methods.name: map_groups
instance_methods.doc:
yields each Group that the user is a member of to the block, and returns
an Iterator of the results of the block. Important: if the result of the
block is nil, it will be ignored (i.e. not a member of the resulting
array) -- hence the resulting array can be of a different size than the
number of groups of which this user is a member.
instance_methods.summary: yields each Group that the user is a member of to the block, and returns an Iterator of the results of the block.

def.name: map_groups
def.body:
Iterator.of do
  each_group do |group|
    yield group
  end
  yield Iterator.stop
end.reject do |__arg0|
  __arg0.nil?
end

instance_methods.name: selected_users
instance_methods.doc:
select the users from the current configuration according to the name,
groups the user is a member of, and/or the user's API key.
instance_methods.summary: select the users from the current configuration according to the name, groups the user is a member of, and/or the user's API key.

def.name: selected_users
def.body:
if name = match_name
  if stripped_name = (name.lchop?('/')).try(&.rchop?('/'))
    name_regex = Regex.new(stripped_name)
    users_list = users_list.select do |user|
      name_regex =~ user.name
    end
  else
    users_list = users_list.select do |user|
      user.name == name
    end
  end
end
if groups = match_groups
  group_matches = Set(Set(Int32)).new
  groups.split(':', remove_empty: true) do |part|
    group_matches << (split_numbers(part))
  end
  users_list = users_list.select do |user|
    group_matches.any? do |group_set|
      group_set.all? do |group|
        user.group_ids.includes?(group)
      end
    end
  end
end
if key = api_key
  users_list = users_list.select do |user|
    user.api_key_hash.verify(key)
  end
  if users_list.size > 1
    raise(DuplicateAPIKey.new(users_list))
  end
end
users_list

instance_methods.name: selected_users
instance_methods.doc:
:ditto:

Yield each of the matching users to a block.
instance_methods.summary: :ditto:
instance_methods.args_string: (match_name, match_groups, api_key, from users_list, &block : DppmRestApi::Config::User -> DppmRestApi::Config::User?)

def.name: selected_users
def.body:
(selected_users(match_name, match_groups, api_key, from: users_list)).each do |user|
  old_user = user
  users_list.delete(user)
  users_list << ((yield user) || old_user)
end

instance_methods.name: split_numbers
instance_methods.doc:
A helper method for the select_users method -- splits a comma-separated
list of numbers in a string into a `Set` of `Int32` values.
instance_methods.summary: A helper method for the select_users method -- splits a comma-separated list of numbers in a string into a Set of Int32 values.

def.name: split_numbers
def.body:
numbers = Set(Int32).new
split_numbers(number_list) do |number|
  numbers.add(number)
end
numbers

def.name: split_numbers
def.body:
number_list.split(',', remove_empty: true) do |raw_group_id|
  yield raw_group_id.to_i? || (raise(InvalidGroupID.new(raw_group_id)))
end

types.name: Route
types.doc: Matches a request to a series of globs loaded from a config file.
types.summary: Matches a request to a series of globs loaded from a config file.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (pull : JSON::PullParser)

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (permissions, query_parameters = {} of String => Array(String))

instance_methods.name: match?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns true if this Route matches the given query parameters. Does not
imply a matching access.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this Route matches the given query parameters.

def.name: match?
def.body:
if query_parameters.any? do |key, _|
  parameters.has_key?(key)
end
else
  return true
end
!(!parameters.find do |key, value|
  if globs = query_parameters[key]?
    globs.any? do |glob|
      File.match?(glob, value)
    end
  end
end)

instance_methods.doc: The permission/access level for this route
instance_methods.summary: The permission/access level for this route

def.name: query_parameters
def.body:
if (value = @query_parameters).nil?
  @query_parameters = ({} of String => Array(String))
else
  value
end

def.name: create
def.body:
api_key = Random::Secure.base64(API_KEY_SIZE)
{api_key, new(Scrypt::Password.create(api_key), groups, name, UUID.random)}

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
set = Set(Int32).new
groups.split(separator: ',', remove_empty: true) do |id|
  set << id.to_i(base: 16)
end
set

def.name: from_h
def.body:
begin
  if (((  groups = data["groups"]?).is_a?(String) && (  name = data["name"]?).is_a?(String)) && (  id = data["id"]?).is_a?(String)) && (  key = data["api-key-hash"]?).is_a?(String)
    new(key, deserialize(groups), name, UUID.new(id))
  end
rescue ArgumentError
  nil
end

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(api_key_hash, group_ids, name, id)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

types.name: Path
types.doc:
A `Path` represents a filesystem path and allows path-handling operations
such as querying its components as well as semantic manipulations.

A path is hierarchical and composed of a sequence of directory and file name
elements separated by a special separator or delimiter. A root component,
that identifies a file system hierarchy, may also be present.
The name element that is farthest from the root of the directory hierarchy is
the name of a file or directory. The other name elements are directory names.
A `Path` can represent a root, a root and a sequence of names, or simply one or
more name elements.
A `Path` is considered to be an empty path if it consists solely of one name
element that is empty or equal to `"."`. Accessing a file using an empty path
is equivalent to accessing the default directory of the process.

# Examples

```
Path["foo/bar/baz.cr"].parent    # => Path["foo/bar"]
Path["foo/bar/baz.cr"].basename  # => "baz.cr"
Path["./foo/../bar"].normalize   # => Path["bar"]
Path["~/bin"].expand(home: true) # => Path["/home/crystal/bin"]
```

For now, its methods are purely lexical, there is no direct filesystem access.

Path handling comes in different kinds depending on operating system:

* `Path.posix()` creates a new POSIX path
* `Path.windows()` creates a new Windows path
* `Path.new()` means `Path.posix` on POSIX platforms and `Path.windows()`
   on Windows platforms.

```
# On POSIX system:
Path.new("foo", "bar", "baz.cr") == Path.posix("foo/bar/baz.cr")
# On Windows system:
Path.new("foo", "bar", "baz.cr") == Path.windows("foo\\bar\\baz.cr")
```

The main differences between Windows and POSIX paths:
* POSIX paths use forward slash (`/`) as only path separator, Windows paths use
  backslash (`\`) as default separator but also recognize forward slashes.
* POSIX paths are generally case-sensitive, Windows paths case-insensitive
  (see `#<=>`).
* A POSIX path is absolute if it begins with a forward slash (`/`). A Windows path
  is absolute if it starts with a drive letter and root (`C:\`).

```
Path.posix("/foo/./bar").normalize   # => Path.posix("/foo/bar")
Path.windows("/foo/./bar").normalize # => Path.windows("\\foo\\bar")

Path.posix("/foo").absolute?   # => true
Path.windows("/foo").absolute? # => false

Path.posix("foo") == Path.posix("FOO")     # => false
Path.windows("foo") == Path.windows("FOO") # => true
```
types.summary: A Path represents a filesystem path and allows path-handling operations such as querying its components as well as semantic manipulations.
